features.title: Type Annotations
features.description: Allows you to specify the type of a variable, function parameter, or return value.

features.title: Interfaces
features.description: Defines the shape of an object, including properties and methods.

features.title: Classes and Access Modifiers
features.description: Enhances object-oriented programming with private, protected, and public access levels.

features.title: Enums
features.description: Defines a set of named constants.

features.title: Generics
Type Aliases
features.description: Gives a type a new name for readability and reuse.
features.example:
type Point = { x: number; y: number };
const point: Point = { x: 10, y: 20 };

features.title: Union and Intersection Types
Utility Types
features.description: Predefined types that help manipulate types easily.

features.title: Type Guards
features.description: Ensures type correctness during runtime using conditional checks.

features.title: Mapped Types
features.description: Allows creation of new types by mapping over existing types.

features.title: Never Type
features.description: Represents a value that will never occur.

features.title: Decorators
features.description: Special syntax for modifying classes and members.

features.title: Module Resolution
features.description: Supports modular code by importing and exporting components.

features.title: Type Assertions
features.description: Forces TypeScript to treat a value as a specific type.

features.title: Optional Properties
features.description: Defines properties that may or may not exist.

features.title: Non-Null Assertion
features.description: Asserts that a value is not null or undefined.
features.example:
const value: string | null = 'hello';
console.log(value!); // Non-null assertion

features.title: Discriminated Unions
features.description: A union of types that share a common property.

features.title: Advanced Tuple Types
features.description: Adds labels and supports variable-length tuple types.
